alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Inland Indian River; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 1:49PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western St. Lucie, Okeechobee, Indian River, southern Brevard and southeastern Osceola Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 149 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Kenansville to 10 miles north of Brighton Seminole Reservation. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Okeechobee, Fellsmere, and Malabar. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Coastal Indian River; Inland Indian River; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee
